Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs lineup remains as stable as ever, with Miguel Amaya cycling back in for Christian Bethancourt, but no other changes.
Shota Imanaga has still been productive, especially his last two times out against the Blue Jays and Marlins (combined): 12.0 IP, 8H, 3ER, 3BB, 9K.

Jake Irvin has been trending in the wrong direction for a couple of months. After an outstanding 8.0 inning scoreless start against the Mets on the Fourth of July, Irvin has allowed 33 earned runs in 50.1 IP (5.90 ERA).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs are facing the Nationals, a theoretically easier opponent.
Shota Imanaga is on the mound tonight.
The Cubs are looking to make it four in a row.

The Cubs lineup includes Ian Happ, LF, Michael Busch, 1B, Seiya Suzuki, DH, Cody Bellinger, RF, Isaac Paredes, 3B, Nico Hoerner, 2B, Dansby Swanson, SS, Pete Crow-Armstrong, CF, and Miguel Amaya, C.
